title: Court orders Sarkozy to face trial over campaign financing
text:
France's former President Nicolas Sarkozy | Bertrand Guay/AFP via Getty Images Court orders Sarkozy to face trial over campaign financing Ex-president accused of overspending during 2012 election.

The highest French appeals court rejected a bid by former President Nicolas Sarkozy to avoid facing trial over alleged illegal campaign financing, Le Monde reported.

The case against Sarkozy centres on accusations that his party, then known as the UMP and now as Les Républicains, worked with a public relations firm called Bygmalion to hide the true cost of his bid for re-election in 2012. Prosecutors claim that he spent nearly €43 million on the campaign, almost twice the spending limit. He was defeated by the Socialist Party's François Hollande.

The trial has been delayed for more than two years because of numerous pleas and challenges filed by Sarkozy’s legal team.

Prosecutors will decide whether to press ahead with a trial but if they do and Sarkozy is convicted, he could face a year in prison and a fine of €3,750.
description: Ex-president accused of overspending during 2012 election.
